quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Words and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, oxford, martin. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: According to the Oxford English Dictionary, this word holds the record for the most separate definitions in the English language.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Set

questions.question: The name, Chargoggagoggmanchauggauggagoggchaubunagungamaugg, containing ten a-s, refers to what United States geographical landmark ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Lake

questions.question: In what movie did  Tom Cruise play Bryan Flanigan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cocktail

questions.question: Heteropalindrome is a term, in a way similar to palindrome, which refers to a number of words with a special property. Can you guess which one of the following words is a heteropalindrome?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gateman

questions.question: According to Aristotle (Politics) and Diodorus Siculus (Diodorus),  Philip II of Macedon (the father of Alexander the Great) was killed as a result of this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A love triangle

questions.question: Martin Luther King, Jr. was murdered on April 4, 1968 while preparing to lead a local march in support of this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A sanitation workers union

questions.question: Words beginning with a double letter are generally very rare in English language, and most of them start with oo. One such word is oomph, which has what basic meaning?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Energy, enthusiasm

questions.question: Aa is one of the few words in the English language which consist entirely of vowels. The word is used in geology to refer to what natural formation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A type of lava

questions.question: Most often, words rhyme if they end in identically or nearly-identically sounding syllables. Which of these words is generally considered as one of the few words impossible to rhyme?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Orange

questions.question: Mark David Chapman, shot John Lennon on December 8, 1980, dropped the revolver and started reading this book.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Catcher in the Rye

questions.question: The assassination of this man triggered WWI.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Francis Ferdinand

questions.question: In the movie Risky Business, Tom Cruses characters name was Joe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In what movie did Tom Cruise play a pool hustler with Paul Newman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Color of Money

questions.question: In how many different ways can ough be pronounced, as part of various English words?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 9

questions.question: In what movie did Tom Cruise play a Greaser?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Outsiders

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Actor and Tom Cruise
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, john. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This Actor is notorious for running from a spray plane in the 1959 movie North by Northwest.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cary Grant

questions.question: Tom Cruises character in Interview with a Vampire was called Lestat.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This actor drove the car in the 1968 feature film Chitty Chitty Bang Bang, based on Ian Flemings book Chitty Chitty Bang Bang: The Magical Car.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dick Van Dyke

questions.question: In what movie did Tom Cruise have an autistic brother named Raymond?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rain Man

questions.question: This actor gave the voice of the snowman in the 1960s version of Rudolf the Red-Nosed Reindeer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Burl Ives

questions.question: This actor is perhaps best-known for playing Joe Mannix in the long-running detective television series, Mannix.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mike Connors

questions.question: In which of these movies did Tom Cruise star with Rebecca DeMornay?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Risky Business

questions.question: In what Tom Cruise movie would you hear the line Show me the money?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jerry McGuire

questions.question: Which actor starred with John Wayne in his final film, The Shootist, playing the role of the doctor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmy Stewart

questions.question: In which of these movies did Tom Cruise star with his ex-wife Nicole Kidman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eyes Wide Shut

questions.question: In what movie does Tom Cruise play a race car driver?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Days of Thunder

questions.question: What great actor played Uncle Joe in the American sitcom Petticoat Junction?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edgar Buchanan

questions.question: This acting legend starred with legendary Jimmy Stewart in the Cheyenne Social Club.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry Fonda

questions.question: Name the actress that played Granny in the TV show Beverly Hillbillies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Irene Ryan

questions.question: These two legendary actors played partners in the 1969 Western Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Redford and Paul Newman

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Trilogy and Story
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, fiction, actor. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This novel is considered to be a deviation from Stephen Kings horror fiction, because this book is a work of classic fantasy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Eyes of the Dragon

questions.question: The Bourne Identity is a spy fiction thriller by Robert Ludlum about an amnesiac who must discover who he is. At the beginning of the story the protagonist is found floating in this sea with several bullet wounds.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mediterranean Sea

questions.question: What is the name of the character, portrayed by Leslie Nielsen in the “Naked Gun” trilogy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lieutenant Frank Drebin

questions.question: Lincoln is a historical novel by Gore Vidal, published in 1984. One of these statements about it is wrong.

options.text: It is set during the American Civil War.
It emphasizes the Presidents political and personal struggles.
It depicts the President through the eyes of foreign delegates.
It is never narrated from the Presidents point of view.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It depicts the President through the eyes of foreign delegates.

questions.question: “Free Willy” is a movie trilogy which centers on which of these?

options.text: a prisoner that escapes from jail only to find out that his brother is in trouble
a brilliant young mathematician that is trying to face his demons and fears by finding true love
the adventures of a boy and an orca
the life of an alcoholic writer

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the adventures of a boy and an orca

questions.question: Antonio Banderas plays Gregorio Cortez in which trilogy directed by Robert Rodriguez?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spy Kids

questions.question: Once upon a time in Mexico” is the third movie of a trilogy directed by Robert Rodriguez. What is the name of the first movie of the trilogy?

options.text: Once upon a time in America

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: El Mariachi

questions.question: Paul Hogan, an Australian actor and comedian born October 8, 1939 in Lightning Ridge, New South Wales, plays the main character in which trilogy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crocodile Dundee

questions.question: Axel Foley, played by Eddie Murphy, is the main character in which of these trilogies?

options.text: From Dusk Till Dawn 3: The Hangmans Daughter

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beverly Hills Cop

questions.question: Which trilogy tells the story of a group of people trapped in a chamber maze?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cube

questions.question: Which movie trilogy tells the story of people who can predict deadly disasters?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Final Destination

questions.question: The Name of the Rose, a 1980 novel by Umberto Eco, depicts a murder mystery set in an Italian monastery during this century.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 14th

questions.question: Cujo is a 1981 novel by Stephen King about a rabid dog. This is the dogs breed.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Bernard

questions.question: This is a trilogy about half-man-half-animal mutants that fight crime.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

questions.question: The Return of the King, The Scorpion King and Queen of the Damned are the names of the three parts of a trilogy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Ice and God
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, oz, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: You need 2 oz vodka, 3 oz Tomato Juice, 1/2 oz Lemon Juice, pepper  salt, 3 dashes Worcestershire, 2 drops Tabasco sauce. Mix all the ingredients in a shaker and add ice. Strain into a highball glass over crushed ice and garnish with a lemon wedge and celery.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bloody Mary

questions.question: Which animal became sacred in Chinese mythology after saving a man who was trapped in a ditch?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tiger

questions.question: Which Celtic goddess was depicted as a bear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Artio

questions.question: Which mythology closely connects women with snakes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Japanese

questions.question: Presumed Innocent is a 1990 motion picture, based on a best-seller of the same name by Scott Turow. This actor played the main role in the movie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harrison Ford

questions.question: Who is considered to be the most beautiful goddess in Norse mythology?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Freya

questions.question: Which god gave the name of March?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mars

questions.question: Hercules is the Roman name of the greatest Greek hero:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heracles

questions.question: Who was the god worshipped at Delphi, Greece?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Apollo Delphinus

questions.question: Mugasa was a god that lived along with people on Earth. He lived in a hut and he didnt want to be seen, but humans didnt obey him. That is why he  made them mortal.  What was his nationality?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: African

questions.question: Why do the seasons change every year?

options.text: Because of gods going to the heavens

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because of gods emotions

questions.question: Windmills of the Gods tells the story of Ashley, a professor of political science in this university.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: University of Kansas

questions.question: This cocktail is made of 1/2 oz rum, 1/2 oz coconut-flavored rum, 1/2 oz grenadine syrup, 1 oz oj, 1 fluid ounce pineapple juice and 1 cup crushed ice. Blend, shake them until the drinks consistency is slushy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bahama Mama

questions.question: What is the color of the Indian god Krishna?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue

questions.question: Judith Krantz is an American novelist, writing in the romance genre. Just one of these four novels of hers was released in the 1980s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Till We Meet Again

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Glass and Ingredients
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, oz, cartoon. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Great Depression in the US inspired these two to start travelling the Southwestern part of the country, robbing banks.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bonnie and Clyde

questions.question: Although these famous dolls are presented as intimate friends, they are named after a brother and sister - who are the children of the dolls creator - Ruth Handler.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barbie and Ken

questions.question: 1/2 shot Kahlua, 1/2 shot Amarula Cream, 1/2 shot Grand Marnier. Pour the ingredients over the back of a spoon in the same order, so that they form layers in the glass.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: B-52

questions.question: Which of these cocktails contains the follwong ingredients: 1 teaspoon powdered sugar, Juice from 1 lime (2 ounces), 4 mint leaves, 1 sprig of mint, Havana Club white Rum (2 ounces) and 2 ounces club soda?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Classic Cuban Mojito

questions.question: Shake 1/2 oz Vodka, 1/2 oz Kahlua, and 1/4 ozIrish Cream liqueur. Put some cracked ice in the shaker as well. Pour into chilled cocktail glass.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mudslide

questions.question: To get properly refreshed, take 1 part vodka, 1 part tequila, 1 part rum, 1 part gin, 1 part triple sec, 1 1/2 parts sweet and sour mix, a splash Coca-Cola. Mix all the ingredients together with some crushed ice in a glass. Pour into a shaker and shake it briskly. Pour the mixture into the glass and garnish with lemon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Long Island Iced Tea recipe

questions.question: For this cocktail you will need 1/2 oz Irish Cream, 1/2 oz coffee liqueur, 1/2 oz hazelnut liqueur, 6 ounces coffee, whipped cream and cinnamon . Mix ingredients into a tall coffee mug. Pour fresh hot coffee over the mixture. Garnish with whipped cream and cinnamon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Irish Cream Coffee

questions.question: The characters of this 1997 cartoon are siblings, although they are from different animal species.  The first episode was quite dramatic, sending the brother to Hell for smoking.

options.text: Wile E. Coyote and Road Runner

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cow and Chicken

questions.question: This non-alcoholic drink originated as medicine against malaria because it contained quinine. However, it was not a pleasant drink and people started mixing it with an alcoholic beverage. Therefore, this famous cocktail was born and its initial purpose - forgotten.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gin and tonic

questions.question: These two cartoon characters are in a constant chase. They appeared in 1940 under the pencil of  William Hanna and Joseph Barbera. The original variation of the short series have won seven Academy Awards.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom and Jerry

questions.question: You need 2 tsp superfine sugar, 1 lime cut into small wedges and 2 to 2 1/2 oz Cachaca (Brazilian cane liquor). Gently mash the lime wedges in a glass. Add sugar and stir until it dissolves into lime juice. Add ice and pour Cachaca. Stir again.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Caipirinha

questions.question: For this cocktail you just need 1 1/4 oz. Cognac and 3/4 oz. Amaretto. Pour them over ice into a snifter and snifter.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: French Connection

questions.question: Take 2 oz. Gin or Vodka and splash a dash of Dry Vermouth. Mix the ingredients and stir with ice. Then strain into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with skewered cocktail onions.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gibson

questions.question: These two are a famous cartoon couple that made their first public appearance in 1929.  Before becoming his partner, she was the star of Thimble Theater and ran in over 600 newspapers.  At the time, she was not the skinny girl from the cartoon today.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Popeye and Olive

questions.question: The male in this couple was the first man in the world, according to the Bible.  God made the woman out of his rib.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adam  Eve

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Rodent and Wisdom
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, cartoon, land. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these mammals is not a rodent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rabbit

questions.question: Complete this statement made by German philosopher, Immanuel Kant: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized ...
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Life

questions.question: Which of these rodents, once native to the West Indies, is now extinct?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giant hutia

questions.question: This couple, created by Robert Louis Stevenson, is like getting 2 for 1. Two personalities are hidden in one, one of them being his normal identity, and the other is his dark side.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde

questions.question: Which cartoon character is known as the fastest mouse in all Mexico?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Speedy Gonzales

questions.question: Keeping what rodent as a pet is illegal in the state of California?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gerbil

questions.question: This proverbial couple was created by Shakespeare. They became victims of their feuding families.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Romeo  Juliet

questions.question: What semi-aquatic rodent is the national animal of Canada?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beaver

questions.question: Complete the following wise sentence which belongs to  Martin Fisher: Knowledge is a process of piling up facts; wisdom lies in their ...
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Simplification

questions.question: What type of teeth do rodents lack?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Canine teeth

questions.question: In the 16th century, the Roman Catholic Church allowed the consumption of what meat during Lent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Capybara meat

questions.question: Finish this sentence, which belongs to orator and statesman, Cicero: The function of wisdom is to discriminate between good and ...
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Evil

questions.question: Which rodent can be trained to sniff out land mines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Gambian pouch rat

questions.question: During the UEFA Champions League semi-final in 2006, what rodent suddenly ran onto the pitch?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Squirrel

questions.question: These two are characters from a famous novel for children. It is about a boy who does not want to grow up and experiences magical adventures.  Before the novel was published, the name of his girlfriend was not common at all.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peter Pan  Wendy
